thread.title: Kala Brown to Appear on 'Dr. Phil' to Talk About Kidnapping Ordeal
thread.title_full: Kala Brown to Appear on 'Dr. Phil' to Talk About Kidnapping Ordeal

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Kala Brown to Appear on 'Dr. Phil' to Talk About Kidnapping Ordeal
text:
Kala Brown, a 30-year-old woman from South Carolina, survived an ordeal that most people would find unimaginable. She says she was abducted and held for two months by an accused serial killer. While she was held, her captor allegedly posed as her boyfriend on Facebook .
More than two months after she went missing, she was found chained up “like a dog” in a metal container on his property. Later, police identified the body of her boyfriend , Charlie Carver, on the same property, which belonged to Todd Kohlhepp. Brown had told police that Kohlhepp shot and killed Carver in front of her.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below According to the Anderson Independent Mail , Kohlhepp is charged with seven counts of murder for not only Carver’s death, but also the deaths of Johnny and Meagan Coxie, who were also found on his property, and four people killed in 2003.
Now, Brown is speaking out in her first-ever interview. She told Phil McGraw she was handcuffed, chained up, gagged, and raped by her captor. “No matter what he did to me, he did not break me,” Brown said. “He cannot destroy me and I won.”
Her full interview with McGraw will air Feb. 13 and 14 on Dr. Phil .
Follow Megan on Twitter .
